title: Plate (View of the Dam and Waterworks at Fairmount)
credit_line: Gift of Mrs. James H. Beal
provenance_text:
The Trade Shop, East Boothbay, ME, until July 1964 [1]; Mrs. James H. Beal (born Rebecca Huebley Jones) [1898-1993], Pittsburgh, PA, July 31, 1964 until October 22, 1964 [2]; gift to Museum of Art, Carnegie Institute, Pittsburgh, PA, October 1964 [3].

Notes:
[1]. The antique shop was owned by E. Prentiss Jones and this wife, Harriet T. Jones.
[2]. Mrs. Beal purchased this plate and another one (64.15.2) for $50 (see Mrs. Beal's notes and receipt from The Trade Shop dated July 31, 1964 in donor file.)
[3]. Mrs. Beal delivered the plate to the museum on September 19, 1964; it was accessioned on October 22, 1964.
